page.title: 20Transport
page.content: {The Railway Station. }Hatfield Peverel Station is 108 years old. It has 2 platforms, a bridge over the track and a ticket collector to take the tickets. We saw an Inter-City train going to Liverpool Street Station, 36 miles away in London. We also saw a goods train with Ford containers from Belgium. It came from Felixstowe. 40 freight trains a day pass through the station and there are 146 passenger trains a day, but some do not stop. 550 passengers a day use the station. Of 66 children in my class, 22 fathers commute to London each day. The fastest journey to Liverpool Street is 43 minutes. The electric passenger trains are powered by overhead lines, and diesel trains also go past. There are 20 lights on the station. Detonators stop the trains in an emergency and are placed 20 yds apart.
